root.name: max()

example.code: int a = max(5, 9); // Sets 'a' to 9 int b = max(-4, -12); // Sets 'b' to -4 float c = max(12.3, 230.24); // Sets 'c' to 230.24
int[] values = { 9, -4, 362, 21 }; // Create an array of ints int d = max(values); // Sets 'd' to 362

root.description: Determines the largest value in a sequence of numbers, and then returns that value. max() accepts either two or three float or int values as parameters, or an array of any length.
